To the chief Musician<S>5329</S>, A Psalm<S>4210</S> and Song<S>7892</S> of David<S>1732</S>. Praise<S>8416</S> waiteth<S>1747</S> for thee, O God<S>430</S>, in Sion<S>6726</S>: and unto thee shall the vow<S>5088</S> be performed<S>7999</S>. <sup>waiteth: Heb. is silent</sup>
O thou that hearest<S>8085</S> prayer<S>8605</S>, unto thee shall all flesh<S>1320</S> come<S>935</S>.
Iniquities<S>1697</S> <S>5771</S> prevail<S>1396</S> against me: as for our transgressions<S>6588</S>, thou shalt purge them away<S>3722</S>. <sup>iniquities: Heb. Words, or, Matters of iniquities</sup>
Blessed<S>835</S> is the man whom thou choosest<S>977</S>, and causest to approach<S>7126</S> unto thee, that he may dwell<S>7931</S> in thy courts<S>2691</S>: we shall be satisfied<S>7646</S> with the goodness<S>2898</S> of thy house<S>1004</S>, even of thy holy<S>6918</S> temple<S>1964</S>.
By terrible things<S>3372</S> in righteousness<S>6664</S> wilt thou answer<S>6030</S> us, O God<S>430</S> of our salvation<S>3468</S>; who art the confidence<S>4009</S> of all the ends<S>7099</S> of the earth<S>776</S>, and of them that are afar off<S>7350</S> upon the sea<S>3220</S>:
Which by his strength<S>3581</S> setteth fast<S>3559</S> the mountains<S>2022</S>; being girded<S>247</S> with power<S>1369</S>:
Which stilleth<S>7623</S> the noise<S>7588</S> of the seas<S>3220</S>, the noise<S>7588</S> of their waves<S>1530</S>, and the tumult<S>1995</S> of the people<S>3816</S>.
They also that dwell<S>3427</S> in the uttermost parts<S>7099</S> are afraid<S>3372</S> at thy tokens<S>226</S>: thou makest the outgoings<S>4161</S> of the morning<S>1242</S> and evening<S>6153</S> to rejoice<S>7442</S>. <sup>rejoice: or, sing</sup>
Thou visitest<S>6485</S> the earth<S>776</S>, and waterest<S>7783</S> it: thou greatly<S>7227</S> enrichest<S>6238</S> it with the river<S>6388</S> of God<S>430</S>, which is full<S>4390</S> of water<S>4325</S>: thou preparest<S>3559</S> them corn<S>1715</S>, when thou hast so provided<S>3559</S> for it. <sup>and: or, after thou hadst made it to desire rain</sup>
Thou waterest<S>7301</S> the ridges<S>8525</S> thereof abundantly<S>7301</S>: thou settlest<S>5181</S> the furrows<S>1417</S> <S>1418</S> thereof: thou makest it soft<S>4127</S> with showers<S>7241</S>: thou blessest<S>1288</S> the springing<S>6780</S> thereof. <sup>settlest: or, causest rain to descend into</sup> <sup>makest: Heb. dissolvest it</sup>
Thou crownest<S>5849</S> the year<S>8141</S> with thy goodness<S>2896</S>; and thy paths<S>4570</S> drop<S>7491</S> fatness<S>1880</S>. <sup>with: Heb. of</sup>
They drop<S>7491</S> upon the pastures<S>4999</S> of the wilderness<S>4057</S>: and the little hills<S>1389</S> rejoice<S>1524</S> on every side<S>2296</S>. <sup>rejoice: Heb. are girded with joy</sup>
The pastures<S>3733</S> are clothed<S>3847</S> with flocks<S>6629</S>; the valleys<S>6010</S> also are covered over<S>5848</S> with corn<S>1250</S>; they shout for joy<S>7321</S>, they also sing<S>7891</S>.
